image.altText: Erin Patterson passes her phone to police during a search of her home in August 2023.

props.synopsis: The jury in Erin Patterson's trial sat through weeks of evidence before convicting her of murder. Here's some of the key pieces shown to the jury during the trial.

title.children: Leftovers, a dehydrator and CCTV: The evidence that convicted Erin Patterson

image.altText: A group of people pose for a photo, all are blurred except for Erin Scutter in the front row, wearing a pink top.

props.synopsis: The world has met Erin Patterson as the murderous cook behind a mushroom meal that killed three relatives. But years before her courtroom infamy, the woman from Melbourne's suburbs divided opinions.

title.children: 'She's no dope': Who is the host of Australia's most infamous lunch?

image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: Kids face down asleep in hoodies, electrical sockets exposed and one child locked in a shed. Documents reveal disturbing revelations from inside Australia's childcare sector in crisis.

title.children: 'Suffocation risk' to kids among fresh new claims about childcare sector in crisis

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair in a hospital with an IV in her arm, which rests on a pillor. She is looking down at her phone.

props.synopsis: There are ways to change the steep cancer trajectories that gen X and millennials might be on.

title.children: If we're to stop the rise in under 50s getting cancer, things need to change

image.altText: People walking past the outside of the Reserve Bank of Australia in Sydney.

props.synopsis: All bets point to a rate cut today, but housing still remains out of reach.

title.children: RBA rate relief at last. But don't expect a housing affordability boost

image.altText: A plate with a smattering of green beans and beef Wellington, and a knife and fork.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, Erin Patterson was a mother of two from a regional town who lived a quiet life. Now, the 50-year-old has been found guilty of murdering three people with death cap mushrooms, in a trial that's made global headlines.

title.children: As Erin's guests prayed for her health, a deadly toxin began its work

image.altText: A sunset photo of a big pile of dirt and a conveyor belt in silhouette

props.synopsis: More than 2,000 labour hire workers employed by BHP in Central Queensland will be paid thousands of dollars more, in a major test of the federal government's laws requiring they be paid the same as directly employed workers.

title.children: Landmark ruling orders BHP to pay labour hire workers an average $30,000 more

image.altText: A woman with blonde long-hair, wearing pale framed glasses, holding a white folder, leaf pattern dress standing outside

props.synopsis: In her 683-page report, Coroner Elisabeth Armitage made 32 formal recommendations for change, after an almost three-year coronial inquest into the police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker. Here are five of the key findings.

title.children: Five key takeaways from the 683-page report into Kumanjayi Walker's death

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a blue suit and white USA cap waving with his right arm raised while about to board Air Force One

props.synopsis: The US president confirmed the new levies by posting the letters he sent to world leaders on social media.

title.children: Trump announces swathes of new tariffs for countries around the world

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump. He his tilting his head and looking ahead with a slight frown.

props.synopsis: A Labor frontbencher reassures "nothing has changed" for Australia after Donald Trump took to social media to unveil new tariffs. Follow live.

title.children: Government says 'nothing has changed' as Trump unveils tariff letters

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Push for Australia to respond to Trump tariffs by removing some of its own
Trump tariffs could have a 'small, positive' effect on Australia: Productivity Commission
'Nothing has changed' for Australia on Trump tariffs

image.altText: The interior of a camp dormitory after it has been flooded, with debris and overturned furniture.

props.synopsis: More than 100 people have died and dozens are still missing after flash flooding swept through Texas.

title.children: Texas floods death toll surpasses 100, with dozens still missing

image.altText: couple looking at computer together on the couch

props.synopsis: A leading Australian fertility lawyer is urging governments to regulate the "wild west" of online semen donation, accusing them of being "asleep at the wheel".

title.children: Calls for online sperm donation to be regulated due to 'lifelong consequences'

image.altText: Reserve Bank sign overlaid with inflation chart

props.synopsis: Markets are pricing in a more than 90 per cent chance of a 0.25 basis point interest rate cut when the Reserve Bank hands down its decision today. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: RBA expected to deliver third interest rate cut of 2025

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The future of Star's Queen's Wharf casino
Two more rate cuts expected in 2025, says CBA chief economist

image.altText: A sign that reads "Bendigo Bank".

props.synopsis: The closure of 10 Bendigo Bank branches across Australia by late October will mean the end of in-person banking for residents in five regional communities.

title.children: Bendigo Bank announces closure of 10 branches in three states

image.altText: A faded sign with animals, it reads Darling Downs Zoo.

props.synopsis: Visitor activities resume at Darling Downs Zoo near Toowoomba, as Workplace Health and Safety Queensland continue to investigate the circumstances around the mauling.

title.children: Queensland zoo reopens two days after woman loses arm in lion attack

image.altText: Workers working on digging a tunnel

props.synopsis: Work has been halted in a concrete lab at Australia's largest pumped hydro project over concerns that up to a dozen workers have been exposed to silica dust.

title.children: Snowy 2.0 concrete lab closed amid concerns workers exposed to silica

image.altText: A middle-aged man with grey-white hair wearing a grey T-shirt looks serious in front of a plain background.

props.synopsis: The US Justice Department says it has videos and pictures of Epstein and victims but will not be releasing any more files from the case as much of it is sealed by a court.

title.children: Justice Department walks back on Epstein's 'client list' claims

image.altText: A yellow excavator is helping demolish the Willyama High School.

props.synopsis: Willyama High School in outback New South Wales is knocked down, after a hygienist's report finds its mould problem is so extreme the building is not worth fixing.

title.children: Demolition of mould-infested high school begins 18 months after closure

image.altText: A couple pose in front of a brick home featuring solar panels on its roof in daylight

props.synopsis: SA Power Networks has begun collecting an "export tariff" from energy retailers at the same time as many solar customers saw a reduction in their feed-in tariffs. But it remains to be seen how, or if, the new export charge will be passed on to consumers.

title.children: Falling feed-ins and new export tariff frustrate solar customers

image.altText: An aerial view of wetlands.

props.synopsis: The temporary closure of Victoria's Winton Wetlands could lead to an explosion in pest numbers and undo decades of environmental programs and research, an ecologist says.

title.children: Ecologist concerned world-class wetlands could be overrun by pests

image.altText: Two cars driving along a highway with a road works sign nearby

props.synopsis: Pitched as a congestion buster for South West holiday traffic, the final cost of the Bussell Highway duplication in Western Australia has ballooned out to $170 million.

title.children: Cost of long-awaited South West highway project blows out by $85m

image.altText: Alex de Minaur holds his racquet to his face with two hands

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur storms out of the gates against Novak Djokovic only to be drawn back in brutal fashion as the Serbian champ advances to the quarterfinals at Wimbledon.

title.children: De Minaur bounced from Wimbledon despite near-perfect start against Djokovic

image.altText: Crash1

props.synopsis: Australian Kaden Groves could be in line to lead Alpecin-Deceuninck after Jasper Philipsen broke his collarbone in a crash.

title.children: Groves in line to lead team after Tour stage winner breaks collarbone

image.altText: Wiaan Mulder holding his bat and wearing a helmet.

props.synopsis: South African all-rounder Wiaan Mulder declares while batting on 367 not out, choosing to honour the record set by the legendary West Indies batter rather than surpassing it.

title.children: Proteas captain declares 34 runs short of beating Lara's Test record

image.altText: A woman of Asian appearance sits on a couch in a dressing gown, wiping her nose with a tissue while looking at her phone.

props.synopsis: If you need a medical certificate for yourself or carer's leave, what are your options if you are short on time and want to save money?

title.children: Easy ways to obtain a medical certificate for sick or carer's leave

image.altText: A picture of a building sign

props.synopsis: Star's shares reached record highs when construction started in Brisbane, now questions remain over its future

title.children: What does the new deadline for an embattled Brisbane casino mean?

image.altText: An illustration of an open lock sitting on top of a keyboard to depict threats to cybersecurity

props.synopsis: A report released by the Audit Office of NSW finds that government agencies only met 31 per cent of mandatory requirements to protect public data.

title.children: The 'worrying pattern' exposed in a government report

image.altText: five members of Chasing Ghosts band pose against white backdrop

props.synopsis: One of the year's best, the new album from Aboriginal-led rock band Chasing Ghosts transforms tough topics into catchy, cathartic anthems.

title.children: One of 2025's best albums will make you cry, rage, reflect

image.altText: A farmer wearing a wide-brimmed Akubra hat looking at a golden sorghum crop.

props.synopsis: Grazier Boyd Webb is running an outback cropping experiment to get him through the next drought, growing sorghum to bury as insurance against the next big dry.

title.children: Grazier prepares for drought by growing sorghum to bury in the outback

image.altText: People gathered for NAIDOC Rally. One lady holds a sign that reads 'Treaty'.

props.synopsis: Tasmania is less than two weeks away from a state election, but so far neither of the major parties have addressed the path to treaty or truth-telling, the state's Aboriginal groups say.

title.children: Tasmania's Aboriginal community calls for treaty ahead of state election

image.altText: Jannik Sinner comforts Grigor Dimitrov after his retirement

props.synopsis: Jannik Sinner receives a major stroke of luck in his quest to win a Wimbledon title as opponent Grigor Dimitrov retires hurt while holding a two-set lead.

title.children: Dimitrov retires hurt while holding two-set lead over Sinner

image.altText: A father and son in maroon-coloured Queensland rugby jerseys embrace.

props.synopsis: Cameron Munster has always given his heart for the Queensland side, but Wednesday night's State of Origin decider will carry extra meaning after the death of his father.

title.children: Grieving Maroons captain to honour late father in State of Origin decider
